vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: inefficient-state-variable-increment
vulnerability_findings.message: <x> += <y> costs more gas than <x> = <x> + <y> for state variables.

vulnerability_findings.name: init-variables-with-default-value
vulnerability_findings.message: Uninitialized variables are assigned with the types default value. Explicitly initializing a variable with its default value costs unnecessary gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: state-variable-read-in-a-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Replace state variable reads and writes within loops with local variable reads and writes.

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-builtin
vulnerability_findings.message: MultiSigWallet.executeTransaction.tx (local variable @ Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#690) shadows built-in symbol "tx"

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
Gifto.returnETHforUnqualifiedBuyers has external calls inside a loop:
	- buyers[i].transfer(buyerDeposit) (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#335)

vulnerability_findings.name: constable-states
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: uint public _totalSupply = 10 ** 14; // total supply is 10^14 unit, equivalent to 10^9 Gifto
vulnerability_findings.message: Gifto._totalSupply should be constant (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#45)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: ERC20Interface.totalSupply (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#14) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Gifto.totalSupply (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#173-178) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Gifto.balanceOf (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#208-213) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function balanceOf(address _owner) public constant returns (uint256 balance);
vulnerability_findings.message: ERC20Interface.balanceOf (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#17) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function transfer(address _to, uint256 _value) public returns (bool success);
vulnerability_findings.message: ERC20Interface.transfer (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#20) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Gifto.transfer (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#344-361) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function transferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint _value) public returns (bool success);
vulnerability_findings.message: ERC20Interface.transferFrom (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#23) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Gifto.transferFrom (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#369-388) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Gifto.approve (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#392-398) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function approve(address _spender, uint _value) public returns (bool success);
vulnerability_findings.message: ERC20Interface.approve (Gifto_ERC20Standard_final.sol#26) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: Integer Arithmetic Bugs (SWC 101)
vulnerability_findings.message:
The arithmetic operator can overflow.
It is possible to cause an integer overflow or underflow in the arithmetic operation. 
Classification: SWC-101

vulnerability_findings.name: Unchecked return value from external call. (SWC 104)
vulnerability_findings.message:
The return value of a message call is not checked.
External calls return a boolean value. If the callee halts with an exception, 'false' is returned and execution continues in the caller. The caller should check whether an exception happened and react accordingly to avoid unexpected behavior. For example it is often desirable to wrap external calls in require() so the transaction is reverted if the call fails.
Classification: SWC-104
